name: Introduction to Neuroscience
description: This course provides an introduction to the field of neuroscience, exploring the major areas of the discipline. It covers topics such as the history of neuroscience, the role of the nervous system, and key principles of neurophysiology. Students will also learn about the anatomy and physiology of the nervous system, and their application to clinical and research settings.

name: Developmental Neuroscience
description: This course provides an overview of the developing nervous system from conception to adulthood. Students will learn about the processes of neural development, including cell proliferation and cell differentiation, and the role of development in the formation of neural networks. The course also covers topics such as the development of sensory systems, neuronal migration, and plasticity.

name: Cellular Neuroscience
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying nervous system function. It covers topics such as cell signaling, ion channels, and synaptic transmission. It also explores the role of the nervous system in motor control and learning and memory processes.

name: Systems Neuroscience
description: This course provides an overview of the organization of the nervous system from the cellular to the systems level. It explores the neural basis of behavior, including motor control, sensory systems, and higher-order cognitive functions. It also covers topics such as the organization of the brain, sensory systems, and the integration of neural information.
